definition: small arched door/boudoir/lady's chamber/by ext. women

sentences.english: Her mother taught her how to drink was the story before she was 16 years old.
sentences.chinese: 梁妈教闺女喝酒，是16岁之前的事。

sentences.english: As soon as your daughter’s hair was long enough, you put it in Leia buns.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你闺女的头发够长了，你就给她扎起俩小圆髻。

sentences.english: Fat daughter comes to challenge, in a battle royal, miscarriage of white jade duckweed.
sentences.chinese: 胖闺女上门挑战，一场混战中，白玉萍小产了。

sentences.english: “You're welcome, old girl,” the vet said, shaking it.
sentences.chinese: “老闺女，不客气，”兽医握着爪子说道。

sentences.english: If maiden in your house, do you say this words again to attempt?
sentences.chinese: 要是你家闺女，你再说这话试试？

sentences.english: Mou Anne stomach Fei, your virgin still turns curved son to scold me not good-looking?
sentences.chinese: 牟安腹诽，你闺女还拐着弯子骂我不好看呢？

sentences.english: The two girls ran away and the youngest boy lives with him.
sentences.chinese: 两个闺女跑了，那个最小的男孩儿和她丈夫一起过。

sentences.english: So the little girl was called "Little Red Coat" by her mother.
sentences.chinese: 从此，她妈妈管小闺女叫“小红袄”。

sentences.english: Xu Chouzi's eldest daughter in casual grows into a big girl.
sentences.chinese: 徐丑子的大女儿在不经意间便出落成为一个大闺女。

definition: daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman
erhua variant of 兒媳婦|儿媳妇[er2 xi2 fu5]
